New Records: Zach LaVine extended his streak of 30-point games to a career-high 5 with 33 points in 33 minutes against the Washington Wizards.

Nikola Vučević recorded his 182nd double-double with the Bulls, surpassing Michael Jordan (180), making him one of only four players in team history with more double-doubles: Artis Gilmore, Scottie Pippen, Horace Grant, and Joakim Noah.
Key Match Events: Lonzo Ball continued his streak of six straight games with at least two steals, showcasing his defensive impact despite playing limited minutes.
Zach LaVine was unaware of his milestone of five consecutive 30-point games after the game, earning a playful reminder from teammate Coby White about checking Twitter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Bulls improved to 8-11 at home after the win, showing progress in their performance on their own court after struggling initially in the season.
The Bulls (18-20) are two games ahead of the Philadelphia 76ers (15-21) for the final play-in spot in the Eastern Conference, with the Brooklyn Nets slipping lower in the standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Patrick Williams struggled with his shooting, finishing 1-for-8 from the floor and 0-for-4 from 3-point range, and showed inconsistencies in his gameplay, not asserting himself sufficiently on the glass.
